contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} In the '''classic era of [[Hollywood]] [[film|cinema]]''' (1930 â€“ 1945) "'''cycles'''" or '''genres''' matured. They were called cycles, which was a short term for stories that were similar. While we would recognize many of the genres as [[Western (genre)|Westerns]], [[Gangster film|gangsters]], [[Musical film|musicals]], etc., often the cycles were significantly more specific. Instead of "romantic comedy" it might be "Boy-meets-girl-boy-loses-girl-boy-gets-girl" cycle. ==See also== * [[Film theory]] * [[Film genre]] * [[Formula fiction]] ''In literary works, generic storylines are referred to as formula fiction.'' {{DEFAULTSORT:Hollywood Cycles}} [[Category:Film production]] {{Film-term-stub}}
